text: hello everyone in this video I'm going
to give you an overview of Amazon
inspector capability that allows you to
perform Center of Internet Security CIS
benchmark assessments for operating
systems in Amazon elastic compute Cloud
Amazon is2 instances before we go
further let's talk a little bit about
Amazon inspector in general Amazon
inspector is a vulnerability Management
Service that continually AWS workloads
for software vulnerabilities and
unintended Network exposure across your
entire AWS
organization once activated Amazon
inspector automatically discovers all of
your Amazon elastic comput Cloud Amazon
Institute instances container images in
Amazon elastic container registry Amazon
ECR and AWS Lambda functions at scale
and continuously monitors them for known
vulnerabilities giving you a
Consolidated view of vulnerabilities
across your AWS compute environment CIS
benchmarks from the center for Internet
Security are a set of globally
recognized and consensus driven best
practices to help security practitioners
Implement and manage their Cloud
security
defenses an example use case here will
be Regulatory Compliance to determine
whether the operating systems running on
your is2 instances meets the security
configurations recommended by
CIS now let's get started in the AWS
console from the AWS console search for
Amazon inspector in the search
box and click on Amazon inspector ctor
select CIA scans from on demand
scans choose create new
scan enter a scan configuration
name for Target resource
tags enter the key and corresponding
value of a tag on the instances that you
want to
scan for for this demo we will use patch
group for
key and Dev for
Value a tag is a label that you assign
to an AWS resource is a two in this case
each tag consist of a key and an
optional value both of which you define
you can specify up to 24 resource tags
to include in this
count choose a CIS Benchmark
level level one is for basic security
configurations the goal of this
recommendation is to reduce the number
of entry points into your systems
reducing your overall cyber security
risk
level two is for advanced security
configurations the goal of this
recommendation is to help you achieve
Regulatory
Compliance level two extends level one
when you choose level two Amazon
inspector checks for all configurations
recommended for level one and two for
this demo we choose level
two for Target accounts specify which
account to include in the
scan you can select all
accounts an Amazon inspector delegated
administrator can select all accounts to
Target all accounts within the
organization you can specify a standal
loone account and enter the 12-digit
account ID
for this demo we select all
accounts choose a schedule for the
scan choose between one time scan which
will run as soon as you finish creating
the scan configuration or recurring
scans which will run at the schedule
time that you choose until it is deleted
Rec scans can run daily weekly or
monthly at a time of your
choice often times customers have had
use case to create Bas operating system
images to be used in the environment
that will do a CIS scan configure image
and then use that new image you can also
use these
settings to configure how the scans will
be
run for this demo we select one time
scan choose create to finish creating
the scan
configuration to access scan
results from the navigation panel under
on demand scans select
scans from scan results you can view
results of all the scans that has been
previously run click on
schedule click on the scan configuration
name
created from the
overview you can see the configuration
name can see the configuration
Arn C Benchmark level who schedule the
scan the scan schedule itself and the
target
account click on resource
taxs you can see the key and value that
was included in the configuration
settings under scan
results click on the scan
AR this leads us to a check
table the checks table displays
identifying information for individual
configuration checks performed in a CIA
scan each check is an individual
configuration check that corresponds to
a specific CIS recommended configuration
for that
system the table includes CIS check ID
for a given
check title that describes the
recommended comp
configuration resource status of the
check the operating system platform the
check applies
to and the CIS level profile of that
check click on scan
resources the scan resources gives you
account of which resources have failed
that
check which resources was not evaluated
or
skipped and which resources
passed click on account
status the account status gives the scan
status of the AWS accounts involved in
the scan configuration
to download kind
results in the upper right corner of the
current page choose all accounts or
select account from the download
dropdown click on all account to
download reports for all the
accounts click on select account and
enter the 12-digit account ID to
download a report for specific
accounts in this video we explored how
to perform CIS benchmark assessments for
operating systems in Amazon ec2
instances using Amazon
inspector you can try Amazon inspector
for 15 days at no cost on the AWS free
trial to learn more and get started
check out the link in the description
thank you
